content.description:
Percentage of International Agreements That Were Executive Agreements

Source: Glenn Krutz and Jeffrey Peake, Treaty Politics and the Rise of Executive Agreements, University of Michigan Press, 2011
content.question: Which of the following statements about the use of executive agreements by presidents is supported by the data in the pie charts?

choices.label: The percentage of international agreements that were executive agreements has increased since 1839.
The percentage of international agreements that were executive agreements has decreased since 1839.
The percentage of international agreements that were executive agreements has decreased since 1989.
The percentage of international agreements that were executive agreements has increased since 1989.

content.answer: The percentage of international agreements that were executive agreements has increased since 1839.

topic.text: 2.4: Roles and Powers of the President

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Describe patterns and trends in data.
